No network needed, no fluffâ€”just fast, reliable JSON export from your Figma canvas. Copy the data to clipboard and use it wherever your workflow takes you: React, Angular, JSON-based APIsâ€”you name it.


Ideal for design-to-dev handoff, prototyping, and frontend engineering.

Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click â€œEnable Arabic Modeâ€ or â€œDisable Arabic Modeâ€
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties â€” please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

plugins.name: Simple inspector
plugins.description:
CSS Extractor is a Figma plugin designed to help developers quickly extract CSS styles from selected elements and their children. ğŸ” Display of selected elements and their child hierarchy.

-


Numeric Variable Checker is a Figma plugin that helps you detect and list raw numeric values in your designâ€”such as padding, spacing, width, height, corner radius, and stroke weightâ€”that are not yet connected to Variables.


Whether you're building a design system or refining your layout for scalability, this plugin ensures your numbers are consistent, maintainable, and tokenized.


It recursively scans all selected frames and their children, highlights unbound values, and lets you jump to each frame with one click.

plugins.name: SPLOC - Selected the parent of component layer
plugins.description:
A plugin for Figma that automatically selects the parent component when any child within the component or its instance is selected.


Main features:

  1. Automatic detection and selection of the parent component
  2. Automatic collapse of the selected component
  3. On/Off switch to enable/disable functionality
  4. Memories the last selection to prevent cyclic selections


How to use:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Launch the plugin (it is active by default)
  3. Select any element within the component or its instance
  4. The plugin will automatically:
  5. Finds the parent component
  6. Select it
  7. Flattens the structure of the component


Interface:

  1. Compact window with ON/OFF switch
  2. The switch allows you to temporarily disable plugin functionality


Technical features:

  1. Works with components (COMPONENT) and their instances (INSTANCE)
  2. Prevents cyclic selections
  3. Optimized for working with large files
  4. Minimal impact on Figma performance


Application:

Ideal for working with large component systems where switching between children and parent components is often required.


----------------------------------------

Introduction

Perspective Transform Pro is a powerful Figma plugin designed for designers to effortlessly achieve perspective transformations on vector graphics. With an intuitive interface and flexible controls, you can quickly adjust the four corner points of your graphics to create professional-grade design effects.


Function Description

  1. Real-Time Perspective Adjustment: Manipulate the four corner points to adjust the perspective of vector graphics in real-time.
  2. Precise Control: Based on relative proportions, ensuring accuracy and consistency in transformations.
  3. Automatic Updates: Automatically recalculates and repositions corner points when selecting new graphics.
  4. Reset Functionality: One-click reset to restore graphics to their original state for easy adjustments.
  5. Compatibility with Various Shapes: Supports rectangles and simple quadrilateral vector graphics.


How to Use

  1. Select a rectangle or quadrilateral vector graphic in Figma.
  2. Run the Perspective Transform Pro plugin.
  3. In the plugin interface, drag the four corner points to adjust the perspective effect.
  4. Click the "Reset" button to restore the graphic to its original state.
  5. Observe the graphic in Figma updating in real-time until you achieve the desired design effect.


Precautions

  1. Supports only simple quadrilateral paths; complex paths may not parse correctly.
  2. It is recommended to backup original graphics before using the plugin to prevent data loss.
  3. The current version does not support curved or multi-path vector graphics.
  4. Ensure Figma is updated to the latest version for the best user experience.

plugins.name: Figma to Scabld
plugins.description:
Effortlessly Import Your Figma Designs into Scabld!


Transform your designs into mobile apps in no time with the Scabld plugin for Figma. Seamlessly bring your Figma screens into Scabld and move from design to a fully functional mobile app without any coding required. Our plugin automatically adapts your design to Scabld's no-code platform, so you can focus on turning your vision into reality.


How to use this plugin


1. Install the free Figma plugin.

2. Select your Figma designs.

3. Import them directly into Scabld.

4. Continue editing and customizing just like in Figma.

5. Add interactions and animations.

6. Finalize and publish your mobile app with zero code.


With Scabld, skip the hassle of manual conversions. Simply import your Figma files into our no-code platform and turn them into fully functional mobile apps. We preserve your layer names and design structure, making it easy to pick up where you left off and enhance your creations for a smooth user experience.


Preserve your layer structure.

When you import your designs, all your Figma groups and layer names are kept intact. This allows you to refine, adjust, and polish your app directly in Scabld without losing any important details.


Performance and optimization guaranteed.

When you publish with Scabld, we ensure your mobile app is optimized for peak performance across all devices. Every file is tuned for a fast and smooth experience, providing a high-quality result without compromising speed.


To learn more about Scabld and explore our other features, visit scabld.com.

plugins.name: Lint copy
plugins.description:
Lint copy helps UX writers and content designers automatically enforce style rules with a custom word list.


Enforce things like plain language (e.g. detect "utilize" and suggest replacing it with "use"), the company's voice and tone (e.g. detect "we are" and suggest using the contraction), and even product terminology.


Create a custom word list in JSON and host it in a public GitHub repository to experience the plugin's full power.


The plugin also enforces sentence case and strings starting with a capital, neither of which is customizable.


For full details, read the documentation.
plugins.tagline: Check text layers against a word list to enforce style, voice, and terminology.

plugins.name: Text Harvest
plugins.description:
Text Harvest exports and updates text layers in bulk with a CSV file

Get a quick CSV file from your designs for your copywriting or localization team.


Export

  1. Make a selection or export the entire page if there's no selection
  2. The plugin export only the visible layers, and also ignore the duplicated ones
  3. You'll get a CSV file with layer names and its content
  4. You can skip text layers that you don't want to export by simply adding the symbol "!" at the beginning of the layer name


Update

  1. Make a selection or update the entire page if there's no selection
  2. Select the CSV file
  3. The plugin updates all the layers with the same name


Currently multicolumn CSV are not supported. If you need to translate to different languages, upload an independent CSV for each one

plugins.name: FlipArabic
plugins.description:
Flip frames, change fonts, and translate copy for Arabic layouts. All with one click.

Let FlipArabic handle localization so you can focus on crafting great experiences.


Made for Your Workflow

  1. Save Time - No hours wasted on manual mirroring or font hunting.
  2. Zero Learning Curve - Select a frame or whole sections for multiple frames and convert!
  3. No Details Lost - Padding, nested auto-layouts, absolute elements, and constraints are all taken care of.
  4. Built-in Translation - AI-powered translation that keeps copy in context (big updates coming in this space).
  5. Smart Font Swapping - Auto-matches weights & styles when exact alternatives aren't available.
  6. Smart Skip for Visuals - Icons, logos, shapes, SVGs & flags keep their original direction.


Fine Tune Your Conversion

  1. Add df or don't flip to layer names to skip flipping
  2. Add dfc or don't flip content to frame names to flip position but keep contents unchanged
  3. Add dt or don't translate to text layer names to keep specific text in English
  4. Add dtc or don't translate content to parent frame names to preserve entire text blocks


For support, ideas or general feedback, reach out to fliparabic@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to Arabic instantly. Flip, change fonts & translate in one click.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Remover
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Remover helps you quickly clean up messy Figma files and make them easier to edit or prototype.


When to use it:

  1. You want to redesign freely. If your design is full of auto layouts and deeply nested frames, and you just want to move things around without dealing with layout constraints â€” this plugin flattens everything so you can edit with ease.
  2. Youâ€™re building an interactive prototype. Auto layouts often create layers and nesting that block or overlap each other. This plugin helps you clean the structure fast â€” so you can bring the right blocks to the top and avoid layout issues.


What it does:

  1. Turns off all auto layouts, keeping objects in place
  2. Ungroups frames and groups without visible styles (no fill, no stroke, or hidden)
  3. Deletes hidden layers and empty frames
  4. Leaves instances and styled frames untouched
  5. Makes your file flat, clean, and easy to work with
plugins.tagline: Remove all auto layouts, empty frames, and groups in one click.

plugins.name: another-data-populator
plugins.description:
Another Data Populator


A Figma plugin that populates your designs with JSON.


How it works


1. Create a Layer Group that contains at least one Text Layer. In the Text Layer content, use placeholders for you data fields in double curly brackets â€“ such as {{firstname}} or {{lastname}}. The plugin will replace all these placeholders with respective data. _Please note that if your Text Layer is called {{name}} (in the Layer List), the content of the Layer will always be overwritten with the data contained in {{name}}. So if you use multiple {{placeholders}} in a Text Layer, you should rename your Layer to something without curly brackets._


2. In the same Layer Group, create a Shape Layer (this is your image placeholder). Give the Shape Layer a placeholder name in double curly brackets â€“ such as {{image}}. The plugin will replace this placeholder with respective image data (PNG or JPG).


3. For JSON arrays, create a Layer Group with a placeholder name like {{items}}. That group must contain one child Group Layer with the name {{template}}. This is the group that will be cloned and populated with the JSON array data. This works recursively with nested data. The array placeholder can have an optional limit filter {{items | limit 5}}, which will limit the number of {{template}} clones.


Available Commands


Populate with Dummy JSON

The plugin includes presets from https://dummyjson.com/ including:


- Products

- Carts

- Recipes

- Users

- Posts

- Comments

- Todos

- Quotes


Populate with Imported JSON

You can also upload any JSON file from your machine.


Filters

By appending your {{placeholder}} with one of the following available filters, separated by a |, you can use certain operations on your populated strings.


1. Maximum characters

You can set the maximum number of characters of your {{placeholder}} by appending it with | max n, 'n' representing the desired number of characters.


{{name | max 3}}


2. Date

Display {{placeholder}} in MM/DD/YYYY format.


{{dateTimeString | date}}


Conditional Actions

A Conditional Action performs a certain action on a Layer Group or Component based on data and a conditional expression. The Conditional Action is controlled by the name of the Layer Group (or Component).


1. #show[condition]

shows layer if true and hides otherwise


2. #hide[condition]

hides layer if true and shows otherwise


2. #duplicate[condition]

duplicate layer n times


3. #variant[condition, component property]

set component property based on condition


Examples

#show[{{firstname}}.length > 3]

shows layer if {{firstname}} has more than 3 characters and hides otherwise


#show[{{firstname}} == "Peter"]

shows layer if {{firstname}} is 'Peter' and hides otherwise


#duplicate[{{rating}}]

duplicates the layer by the value of {{rating}}


#variant[{{completed}}, Value Type = Checked]

sets the component property "Value Type" to "Checked" if {{completed}} is true


You can combine several conditions:


#show[{{firstname}}.includes('e') || {{firstname}}.length > 3]

shows layer if {{firstname}} includes 'e' or has more than 3 characters, hides otherwise


Or several Conditional Actions:


#variant[{{completed}}, Value Type = Checked] #variant[{{completed}}, State = Completed]

sets the component properties "Value Type" to "Checked" and "State" to "Completed" if {{completed}} is true


Pure JavaScript syntax is being used for Conditional Actions, so you can basically use anything available in JavaScript.
plugins.tagline: Populate your designs with JSON

plugins.name: Get Image Type
plugins.description:
A simple plugin that analyzes your selected images and reveals their file formats with a single click. Stop guessing if that asset is a JPG, PNG, SVG, or WebP.


Does not support:

  1. Video/Movie Files: This plugin does not support identification of video or movie formats.


Note: Figma automatically converts certain image formats during import. HEIC and TIFF/TIF files are converted to PNG format when imported into Figma, so the plugin will identify these as PNGs. This reflects the actual format of the image within Figma, not necessarily the original source format.

ğŸ§­ FrameNavigator


Effortlessly navigate large and complex Figma files with FrameNavigator â€” a floating Table of Contents plugin that helps you stay organized and move between frames in a single click.


âœ¨ Key Features


- Quick Navigation

Instantly jump to any frame from a floating panel that stays visible while you work.


- Custom Frame Registration

Select frames directly on the canvas and add them to your TOC with a simple "+" button.


- Group Organization

Organize your frames into custom groups for better structure and clarityâ€”perfect for managing multiple screens.


- Flexible Panel Sizes

Choose between default, compact, and full views to match your workflow and screen space.


---


ğŸ›  How It Works


  1. Register a Frame: Select a frame on the Figma canvas and click the `+` button in the plugin to add it to the TOC.
  2. Create a Group: Hover over ungrouped frames in the TOC and click the appearing checkbox to select them. Then click the Create Group button at the top of the panel to group them.
  3. Add to Existing Group: Select a group first, then select a new frame on the canvas and click `+` to add the frame into that group.
  4. Rename a Group: Double-click on a group name to edit it.
  5. Remove a Group: Right-click on a group and select **Remove Group**. âš ï¸ Note: All frames inside that group will also be removed from the TOC.
  6. Reorder Frames: Drag and drop frames (or groups) within the TOC to change their order.


---


Perfect for design system creators, large prototyping flows, or anyone managing multi-screen layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly jump between frames with a floating table of contents. Easily build your own TOC.

plugins.name: Action Recorder
plugins.description:
Smart Action Recording: Automatically captures all your design modifications including component variant changes, style adjustments, and property edits.


Editable Actions: Modify recorded actions directly in the interfaceâ€”change values, adjust properties, and fine-tune your automation without re-recording.


Playback: Apply recorded actions to any selected elements with perfect fidelity, ensuring consistent design implementation across your projects.

plugins.name: UnfigShadow
plugins.description:
UnfigShadow - Advanced Shadowing for Figma is a professional plugin that brings realistic, multi-layered shadow generation into your design workflow. Unlike Figmaâ€™s native shadow tools, this plugin lets you control shadow distance, direction, blur, opacity decay, steps, and colorâ€”all through a clean and intuitive interface.


Create complex light and depth effects in seconds without needing to manually stack shadow layers. Ideal for UI/UX designers, component libraries, and anyone seeking to add realistic depth to their interfaces.
plugins.tagline: Advanced Shadowing for Figma
